horse_breed.name: appaloosa
horse_breed.personality: The Appaloosa is independent, intelligent, and courageous. It can also be fierce -- making it an ideal war horse in the past. Currently, it is considered one of the best riding horses, especially for those who know how to handle horses.

horse_breed.name: thoroughbred
horse_breed.body_type: Deep chest; lean, athletic build; long neck; powerful hindquarters
horse_breed.personality: As a breed, Thoroughbred horses are intelligent and energetic, with a strong work ethic. They can also be bold and spirited, making them better suited to a more experienced equestrian rather than a beginner.

horse_breed.name: arabian
horse_breed.body_type: Lithe, compact body; small, wedge-shaped head; dished facial profile, long, arched neck
horse_breed.personality: The Arab is very intelligent. A quick learner with high spirits, it makes for a great riding horse. However, the Arab has been known to become aggressive if and when it is mistreated by its handler.

horse_breed.name: american paint
horse_breed.body_type: Strong, well-balanced body; colorful coat patterns; powerful hindquarters
horse_breed.personality: Beyond their beauty, paints are prized for their friendly, easygoing temperament. These are relaxed and highly social horses with natural intelligence that makes them unchallenging and rewarding to train.
